website_summaries.verdict: The LG Leon is a passable budget smartphone, but it's worth spending a little more for the Motorola Moto G or the 4.7-inch Alcatel OneTouch Idol 3.
pros: The LG Leon is competitively priced, has expandable memory, and for T-Mobile customers, it makes reliable calls over both cellular and Wi-Fi
cons: The handset's camera takes mediocre photos and lacks touch-focus, and its performance is sluggish

customer_reviews.title: Eh . . . good "budget" smartphone for light users
customer_reviews.text: Poor battery life. GPS unreliable. If you're a light user and just want the capabilities of a smartphone available to you, this should fit your needs. If you are thinking of using this to watch videos, play games, Facebook, Instagram, or constantly check it, look elsewhere or get yourself a backup battery to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Bredwell

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this phone.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible phone. Super slow, and no storage space for my apps. Even when I moved all my apps over to my sd card it still said there was no storage space on my phone. Do not buy this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for decent cost.
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up to replace an Alcatel that died prematurely & it works great. Has hotspot capability,usb tethering & uses micro sd card,only downside is it's not compatible with some apps like scan n go for example & could stand to have a slightly bigger screen. Uses the micro SIM card,has a decent camera,good sound quality for calls & is pretty decent for music if not somewhere noisy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smelko

customer_reviews.title: Great phone, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great phone for my son! He dropped his Lg K10 in the water so I replaced it with this. Was looking for something inexpensive that I could easily add to his Tmobile line on out family data plan. A month later I purchased one for my daughter. They're content now.
customer_reviews.author: LovinDaSkinImIn

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 20 days!
customer_reviews.text: Got phone to replace my phone with a cracked screen. Phone worked fine for 20 days. Never dropped or got wet. Phone now will cycle on and off every 30 seconds as long as battery is installed. I will never buy a phone this way again. No warranty is what I was told??? Ridiculous
customer_reviews.author: Wells W.

customer_reviews.text: Fast ship, but phone was missing the new SIM card that it should have came with per the sales ad. The phone was really scratched up and the battery looks terrible with a bend mark and moisture damage indicator. Emailed about the missing SIM card, but haven’t received a response.

I've had it for 1 day and it is worse than my last phone which was ironically cheaper. If you just want it purely for the purpose of listening to music and or making calls and texts, then this is a pretty good phone for that purpose. If you want to do anything more than that? Well... prepare for some serious frustration right off the bat.

customer_reviews.title: Very basic. No OTG, camera isn't very good.
customer_reviews.text: Works as a phone, but is very primitive. I went to android because I wanted to use specific apps, notably a USB borescope. This phone lacks "USB On-the-go" (OTG) so it won't work with the external camera. As others have noted, the built-in camera is terrible. The shots come out blurry. Not sure if it's just this phone, but there are system updates at least once a week. I'm dumping it and replacing it after only six months. It won't run the simplest apps anymore because the 8G memory is completely full of undeletable junk. Seems like it's being pushed to its absolute limit, and will fail for no reason.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M. Close

customer_reviews.title: Great phone! Nice for a young teen that needs a basic smart phone.
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this phone. It was very easy to setup, I installed the SIM quickly and the instructions were clear. It came with everything indicated. I wish I had bought this phone first for my 13 year old son. It is a great simple smart phone for younger kids to use that doesn't cost much.

However the sound is not very loud even at max volume its difficult to hear.

product_meta.title: LG Leon 4G LTE H345 SmartPhone (T-Mobile)
product_meta.description: See the shape of allure from every angle. With LG Leon (LTE), experience the joy of beauty and performance together. With unique LG experiences – Gesture shot, KnockOn, QuickMemo+, and more take interactivity to a whole new level Have all your needs met with the 1.2GHz Quad-Core capabilities and experience the power to effortlessly multitask. Activate the camera by opening your hand and close to start the countdown, letting you snap moments more conveniently. A touch anywhere on the screen lets you instantly shoot high quality images with the 8MP Auto-Focus camera. Even in the dark you can now easily capture selfies with more clarity by using the screen as the flash. Gain instant, secure access to your home screen with over 86,000 possible codes by tapping a personalized pattern anywhere on the display, even with one hand. The rear key is cleverly placed directly under the index finger when held in-hand making it easy to use with convenient shortcuts and volume control.
feature_bullets: 5-megapixel main camera with full HD video capture
Front-Facing Camera with Gesture Shot and Soft Light
Will work only with T-Mobile service, T-Mobile SIM Card Required

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars240 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
specifications.Additional Features: Comes with charger and new SIM card
